TypeSignature.Value: public class PrintStream : Java.IO.FilterOutputStream, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Lang.IAppendable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintStream extends Java.IO.FilterOutputStream implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class Java.Lang.IAppendable, class System.IDisposable
type PrintStream = class inherit FilterOutputStream interface ICloseable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IAppendable

Docs.summary: A PrintStream adds functionality to another output stream, namely the ability to print representations of various data values conveniently.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public PrintStream (Java.IO.File file);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.IO.File file) cil managed
new Java.IO.PrintStream : Java.IO.File -> Java.IO.PrintStream

Docs.param: The file to use as the destination of this print stream. If the file exists, then it will be truncated to zero size; otherwise, a new file will be created. The output will be written to the file and is buffered.
Docs.summary: Creates a new print stream, without automatic line flushing, with the specified file.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while opening or creating the target file.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.IO.PrintStream Format (string format, params Java.Lang.Object[] args);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.IO.PrintStream Format(string format, class Java.Lang.Object[] args) cil managed
abstract member Format : string * Java.Lang.Object[] -> Java.IO.PrintStream override this.Format : string * Java.Lang.Object[] -> Java.IO.PrintStream

Docs.param: A format string as described in Format string syntax

Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
Docs.summary: Writes a formatted string to this output stream using the specified format string and arguments.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
